review_text: The hotel itself was charming; however, the room we were given was right next to the front desk on the first floor, facing a busy street. We could hear conversations from the front desk, which made it feel like we had little privacy. Unfortunately, someone had also left the windows open before our arrival, and we didn‚Äôt realize it until later. We stayed for two nights, but both the first night and the following day were very noisy due to loud street noise ‚Äî people talking and shouting, likely from nearby bars ‚Äî which made it extremely difficult to relax and sleep. Breakfast was okay, but overall, I had a poor experience and wouldn‚Äôt choose to stay here again.
review_response: Dear Shiho, Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We're truly sorry to hear that your experience did not meet your expectations and that your stay was impacted by noise from both the street and our front desk area. We understand how important a quiet and restful environment is for our guests, and we regret that we fell short in this regard during your visit. We also apologize for the oversight with the windows being left open prior to your arrival.That is certainly not the standard we strive to uphold. Please know that your comments have been shared with our team so we can take steps to ensure similar issues do not occur in the future. While we‚Äôre glad you found the hotel charming and breakfast acceptable, we are disappointed to learn that these aspects were not enough to improve your overall impression. We genuinely hope you might consider giving us another opportunity in the future, perhaps in a quieter room away from the street. Warm Regards, Alecrim Team

And the small table for two overlooking the small balcony was delightful. Wish we‚Äôd been in Lisbon more than one night - we would have happily stayed a few days!
